Live from NPR News in Washington I'm Jim hock circle crews are working to restore power across parts of the Florida Panhandle but were devastated by hurricane Michael as NPR's Joel Rose reports many customers are expected to have their power back within weeks
The utility Gulf Power says it's optimistic about restoring electricity to Ninety five percent of customers who are ready to take it by October twenty fourth two weeks after the storm made landfall that includes Panama City and other areas that were battered when hurricane Michael came ashore last week
Electrical workers across the panhandle of been working to rebuild infrastructure that was destroyed the storm snapped electric poll downed wires and even brought down high voltage transmission lines Joel Rose NPR News Miramar Beach Florida
